sn52.7:4.2: There Venerable Anuruddha addressed the mendicants:
sn52.7:5.1: “Reverends, when these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed and cultivated they lead to the ending of craving.
sn52.7:5.3: It’s when a mendicant meditates by observing an aspect of the body …
sn52.7:5.6: principles, keen, aware, and mindful, rid of desire and aversion for the world.
sn52.7:5.7: When these four kinds of mindfulness meditation are developed and cultivated they lead to the ending of craving.”
